body_html:
@CynthiaLu1119 I realized that the above solution isn't correct in that it will have the incorrect behavior when in .eval mode (it will use the running stats unlike before it will still use the data stats). The better solution is to torch.load(..., strict=False).

FYI #6086
body_text:
@CynthiaLu1119 I realized that the above solution isn't correct in that it will have the incorrect behavior when in .eval mode (it will use the running stats unlike before it will still use the data stats). The better solution is to torch.load(..., strict=False).
FYI #6086
body:
@CynthiaLu1119 I realized that the above solution isn't correct in that it will have the incorrect behavior when in `.eval` mode (it will use the running stats unlike before it will still use the data stats). The better solution is to `torch.load(..., strict=False)`.

FYI https://github.com/pytorch/pytorch/pull/6086
